title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Definition, Scope and Importance of Architectural Research; The process of research â developing concepts, formulating hypotheses and empirical testing; Research strategy â Approaches (Diagnostic, descriptive, theoretical and action), Designs (Case study, Survey, Experiment) and Settings (Natural, Contrived); Substance and context of research â professional and academic; Analogical, deductive and inductive reasoning; Analytical and synthetic processes in design and practice.Assessing the performance of built environment â aesthetic, functional, social and economic; Perceptions, attitudes and values of the observer; Complexity, scale and level of analysis. New areas of research: Style and creativity in research process, architectural communication, value engineering and building economics research, culture and content, mathematics, science and art in architecture, evaluation research â alternative generation and optimization techniques.
